title: Greet with kindness
text: Say a warm 'Good morning' to the watchman or helper you meet today. A small greeting brightens someone's day.
deeds: Greet one person with a smile and kind words

title: Call home
text: Call a parent or elder and tell them you love them. It takes 30 seconds but means the world.
deeds: Call and say 'I love you' or ask how they are

title: Encourage a peer
text: Say 'You did great' to a classmate or colleague. Small encouragement builds confidence.

title: Hold the door
text: If someone is walking behind you, hold the door open. A tiny gesture of care matters.
deeds: Hold the door for one person today

title: Say thank you
text: When receiving food, delivery, or help — say 'Thank you' sincerely.
deeds: Say thank you to a helper today

title: Compliment effort
text: Appreciate someone for trying, not just succeeding. Example: 'I like the way you tried.'

title: Pick up litter
text: If you see a wrapper on the road, pick it up and throw it in a bin.
deeds: Pick up one piece of litter today

title: Listen fully
text: When a friend talks, put your phone away and just listen.
deeds: Listen to one person without distractions

title: Share a smile
text: Smile at someone you don’t usually talk to. Smiles are contagious.

title: Help carry
text: If you see someone with heavy bags, offer to help for a short distance.
deeds: Offer to carry or support a small load

title: Share your snack
text: Break your chocolate or chips and share with a friend.
deeds: Share one snack with someone today

title: Check on a friend
text: Message a friend you haven’t spoken to in a while. Just say 'How are you?'.
deeds: Send one check-in message to a friend

title: Forgive quickly
text: If someone makes a small mistake, let it go without reacting.

title: Give water
text: Offer a glass of water to a guest, colleague, or stranger.
deeds: Offer drinking water to one person today

title: Appreciate service staff
text: Say 'Thanks bhaiya/didi' to delivery, cleaner, or security staff.

title: Be patient
text: In traffic or a queue, don’t honk or push. Take a calm breath.

title: Encourage a child
text: Tell a younger sibling or kid 'You did well' at something.

title: Say sorry
text: Apologize for a small thing you overlooked. Example: 'Sorry I was late.'

title: Donate small
text: Give one book, old clothes, or item you don’t need to someone who can use it.

title: Encourage online
text: Post one positive or helpful comment on social media.

title: Stand up for others
text: Offer your seat to an elder or pregnant woman in transport.
deeds: Give up your seat once today

title: Help with notes
text: Share class notes or resources with a peer.

title: Encourage efforts
text: Tell someone 'I noticed your hard work' — not just the result.

title: Be punctual
text: Arrive on time for class or meeting today.

title: Help with tech
text: Assist a family member with a phone or app issue.
deeds: Help one person with tech today

title: Compliment appearance
text: Say 'Nice shirt!' or 'Cool hairstyle!' to someone.

title: Clean your space
text: Clear your desk or room for 5 minutes.

title: Encourage online learning
text: Share a free course link or article with a friend.

title: Support a teammate
text: Say 'Good job' when someone contributes in class or work.

title: Respect elders
text: Stand up when an elder enters or greet them warmly.
deeds: Greet or respect one elder today

title: Encourage self
text: Write one positive line about yourself in a notebook.

title: Reduce plastic
text: Say no to one plastic bag and carry your own.

title: Offer directions
text: If someone looks lost, help them with directions.

title: Respect time
text: End a phone call or meeting on time.

title: Wish someone
text: Send 'Happy Birthday' or 'Congrats' to someone you know.

title: Encourage fitness
text: Tell a friend 'Great job for working out' or walk with them.

title: Offer your pen
text: In class/office, lend a pen to someone who forgot.

title: Compliment smile
text: Say 'You have a nice smile' to someone.

title: Encourage honesty
text: When someone admits a mistake, respond kindly.

title: Help the environment
text: Switch off one unnecessary light or fan.

title: Thank teachers
text: Say 'Thank you for teaching us' to a teacher/mentor.

title: Support junior
text: Guide a junior in school/office with one tip.

title: Respect workers
text: Say 'Namaste' or greet a cleaner/security guard.

title: Offer to share
text: Ask 'Do you want some?' before eating in front of someone.

title: Smile online
text: Use one smile emoji in a chat today to spread positivity.

title: Clap for effort
text: Clap sincerely for someone’s performance (even if small).

title: Check on neighbor
text: Say 'How are you?' to a neighbor or society uncle/aunty.

title: Thank transport staff
text: Say 'Thank you' to bus conductor/auto driver/uber driver.

title: Encourage artist
text: Like/comment on someone’s drawing/song online.

title: Give seat to elder
text: Offer your chair if an elder is standing.

title: Respect time slots
text: Join class/meeting 5 min early as respect.

title: Compliment dress
text: Say 'Nice kurta' or 'Cool shirt' to someone.

title: Encourage reading
text: Share one book recommendation with a friend.

title: Share earphones
text: Offer to share music with a friend safely.

title: Say 'Well tried'
text: Encourage a friend even if they failed at something.

title: Encourage volunteer
text: Thank someone who volunteers or helps others.

title: Be eco-friendly
text: Carry your own bottle or bag instead of plastic.

title: Encourage family
text: Say 'Good job' to a sibling or parent for a small effort.

title: Be calm online
text: If you disagree online, respond respectfully.

title: Help with chores
text: Wash one plate or sweep a small area at home.

title: Offer a warm welcome
text: Smile and welcome a new person at work or class. A gentle 'Welcome!' helps them feel seen.
deeds: Say 'Welcome' to one new person today

title: Share a helpful tip
text: If someone struggles with a small task, offer a quick tip that helped you before.
deeds: Give one helpful tip to someone who needs it

title: Thank quietly
text: Leave a short thank-you note or message for someone who helped you recently.
deeds: Send one short thank-you message today

title: Give space
text: If someone needs time or privacy, give them space without asking questions.
deeds: Respect someone’s space when they need it today

title: Offer to take a photo
text: If strangers want a photo together, offer to take it for them with a smile.
deeds: Offer to take or help with one photo today

title: Share a small resource
text: Recommend one short article or video that helped you recently.
deeds: Share one useful resource with a friend

title: Water a plant
text: Tend to a plant (yours or a neighbor’s) for a minute — plants respond to care.
deeds: Water or check one plant today

title: Send encouragement
text: Send a short message to someone facing a small challenge: 'You’ve got this.'

title: Pay a simple compliment
text: Notice something genuine and tell it — ‘Nice work on that presentation’.

title: Help clean a common space
text: If you share a kitchen or desk area, clear one small spot for everyone’s comfort.

title: Offer a brief hand
text: If a coworker seems busy, offer to help with one small thing for five minutes.
deeds: Offer five minutes of help to a busy person

title: Share a light joke
text: Share a gentle, kind joke to lift someone’s mood (nothing mean).
deeds: Share one light joke or smile today

title: Thank the cook
text: If someone prepares food at home or office, thank them for their effort.
deeds: Say thank you to the person who cooked today

title: Hold on to calm
text: When conversation gets tense, take a breath and speak calmly to ease it.
deeds: Use a calm tone in one tense moment today

title: Share a small item
text: Offer a bookmark, pen, or charger if someone needs it briefly.
deeds: Lend a small useful item to someone today

title: Say 'I appreciate you'
text: Tell someone you appreciate them for a specific reason — it warms their day.
deeds: Tell one person 'I appreciate you' today

title: Respect differences
text: If opinions differ, listen to understand rather than to reply.
deeds: Listen patiently to a differing viewpoint today

title: Offer water to others
text: Carry an extra bottle and offer it to someone who might need it.
deeds: Offer water to one person today

title: Give a simple tip
text: Share one quick life-hack you use (phone shortcut, recipe tweak).
deeds: Share one simple useful tip today

title: Pick up a small trash
text: If you see litter, pick it up and dispose it properly — small actions add up.
deeds: Pick up one piece of litter today

title: Give space in queue
text: If someone is behind you and rushing, let them go first politely.
deeds: Let one person go ahead in a queue today

title: Encourage a hobby
text: Compliment someone’s hobby or creative effort — it helps them keep going.

title: Share an inspiring quote
text: Send a short, positive quote to someone who might need it today.
deeds: Share one short inspirational line today

title: Offer a simple ride
text: If you’re driving and a friend needs a short lift, offer if you can.
deeds: Offer a short ride to someone when safe

title: Be present
text: During a conversation, look at the person and give full attention for a minute.
deeds: Give full attention to one conversation today

title: Share a resource for study
text: If a classmate struggles, share one clear resource that helped you.
deeds: Share one study resource with a peer

title: Offer a gentle reminder
text: If a friend forgets something small, remind them kindly — not scold.

title: Praise improvement
text: Notice small improvements in someone and tell them — it encourages more effort.
deeds: Praise one small improvement you see today

title: Ask 'How can I help?'
text: When you spot a need, simply ask if you can help, even briefly.
deeds: Ask one person 'How can I help?' today

title: Share a healthy snack
text: Offer a fruit or simple snack to someone who seems tired.
deeds: Share one small healthy snack today

title: Offer a seat at lunch
text: Invite someone who is alone to join your lunch table for a short while.
deeds: Invite one person to join you for a meal today

title: Encourage effort publicly
text: Praise someone’s effort in a group setting to boost their confidence.
deeds: Give public praise to someone’s effort today

title: Share a calming tip
text: Share one breathing or focus tip with a stressed friend.
deeds: Share one calming tip with someone today

title: Thank a helper
text: Thank someone who quietly helps behind the scenes — cleaners, admins, etc.

title: Listen to an elder
text: Sit with an elder and ask about one memory — listening honors them.
deeds: Ask an elder about one memory today

title: Share a positive note
text: Leave a short sticky note of thanks for someone to find later.
deeds: Leave a small positive note for someone today

title: Offer to babysit briefly
text: If a friend needs a quick hand with a child, offer a short help if you can.
deeds: Offer brief help to a parent today

title: Express curiosity
text: Ask someone about their interests — curiosity shows you care.
deeds: Ask one person about their hobby today

title: Share a good link
text: Share one short article or video that made you smile or think.

title: Give a warm send-off
text: When someone leaves a meeting, wish them well — 'Take care' goes far.
deeds: Wish someone well as they leave today

title: Offer to proofread
text: If a friend needs a quick read of a message or note, offer a glance.
deeds: Offer to proofread one short message today

title: Give a listening ear
text: If a friend seems quiet, ask gently 'Are you okay?' and listen.
deeds: Ask and listen to one quiet friend today

title: Hand out encouragement
text: Write a short encouraging line and give it to a teammate before a task.
deeds: Give one encouraging line to a teammate today

title: Share gratitude publicly
text: Thank someone publicly in a group message or chat for their help.

title: Offer to run errand
text: If you have time, offer to pick up a small item for a neighbor or friend.
deeds: Offer a quick errand help to someone today

title: Give a calm response
text: When criticized, respond calmly — 'Thanks for the input' keeps harmony.
deeds: Respond calmly to any criticism today

title: Praise small wins
text: Celebrate a small personal win with someone who helped you.
deeds: Share one small win with a helper today

title: Offer an umbrella
text: If rain starts and someone is without cover, offer your umbrella briefly.
deeds: Offer cover to someone in rain today

title: Share a learning
text: Tell someone one thing you learned recently that might help them.
deeds: Share one learning with a friend today

title: Say 'I noticed you'
text: Tell someone you noticed their effort — it shows presence and care.
deeds: Tell one person 'I noticed you' today

title: Offer a small favour
text: Do one tiny favour without being asked — it matters more than you think.
deeds: Do one small favour for someone today

title: Help a stranger
text: If safe, help a stranger with directions or a small task they ask for.
deeds: Help one stranger with directions or info today

title: Encourage a learner
text: If someone is learning, tell them 'You're getting better' to motivate them.

title: Share a calming message
text: Send a simple 'Take a breath' message to someone who seems rushed.

title: Give a thoughtful reply
text: Respond thoughtfully to a message instead of a quick short reply.

title: Help tidy a shared area
text: Spend two minutes to tidy a shared shelf or table in your space.
deeds: Tidy one shared spot for two minutes today

title: Praise kindness
text: When you see someone being kind, tell them you noticed — it spreads more kindness.

title: Offer to brief someone
text: If a colleague missed a meeting, offer a quick 2-minute summary.
deeds: Offer a short meeting summary to a colleague

title: Share a positive memory
text: Tell someone a short happy memory involving them — it brightens their day.
deeds: Share one positive memory with someone today

title: Offer a simple thanks
text: At the end of the day, thank someone who made your day easier in any small way.
deeds: Say thanks to one person before the day ends

title: Encourage teamwork
text: When working in a group, acknowledge everyone’s role. Example: 'That was a helpful idea.'

title: Offer a gentle reminder
text: Remind a friend about a small task kindly — not like a scolding.

title: Be kind in traffic
text: If someone cuts in by mistake, let it go without anger.
deeds: Show patience once in traffic today

title: Praise patience
text: Notice someone waiting calmly and say, 'That was patient of you.'

title: Offer your place
text: If someone looks tired, offer your chair or seat.

title: Send a kind emoji
text: Send a heart ❤️ or smile 🙂 to brighten a chat.

title: Thank your family
text: Say 'Thanks for cooking' or 'Thanks for supporting me' at home.

title: Compliment handwriting
text: If someone writes neatly, mention it. Small notice feels good.

title: Encourage small effort
text: If someone starts a new habit, say, 'Good start!'
deeds: Encourage a new habit once today

title: Offer directions calmly
text: If asked, give directions with patience even if you’re busy.
deeds: Help one person with directions today

title: Smile when serving
text: If you hand something to someone (like notes or food), do it with a smile.
deeds: Pass one item with a smile today

title: Say 'Good effort'
text: Encourage someone even if they didn’t succeed fully.

title: Offer to share umbrella
text: If it rains, offer to cover a friend or stranger briefly.
deeds: Share umbrella once today if possible

title: Celebrate quietly
text: Clap softly or nod when someone achieves something.

title: Ask for input
text: Invite a quieter person to share their view in class or meeting.
deeds: Ask one quiet person’s opinion today

title: Respect time online
text: Keep your reply short if someone is busy, so you respect their time.
deeds: Send one mindful, short reply today

title: Offer your charger
text: If someone’s phone is low, lend your charger for a bit.

title: Say 'Nice try'
text: When a child or peer fails, encourage them with 'Nice try!'

title: Pick up after yourself
text: Leave a clean desk or dining table for the next person.
deeds: Clean up after yourself once today

title: Offer to carry light load
text: If someone is holding many things, help carry one item.
deeds: Carry one item for someone today

title: Encourage practice
text: If someone is practicing (music, sport), say 'Keep going!'

title: Say 'Good morning' first
text: Greet someone before they greet you — small initiative spreads warmth.

title: Help find info
text: If someone is confused, help search or explain quickly.
deeds: Help one person find info today

title: Say 'Take care'
text: When parting, tell someone 'Take care' warmly.

title: Compliment voice
text: If someone speaks clearly, mention 'You have a nice voice.'

title: Give a patient ear
text: Let someone finish their story without interrupting.

title: Appreciate punctuality
text: Notice someone arriving on time and say, 'Thanks for being punctual.'

title: Offer to explain
text: If someone missed a detail in class, explain briefly.
deeds: Explain one detail to a peer today

title: Encourage self-care
text: Tell a friend 'Drink water' or 'Rest a bit' when they’re tired.

title: Smile at staff
text: When a guard or cleaner passes by, smile at them warmly.
deeds: Smile at one staff member today

title: Say 'Well done'
text: Even for a small act, say 'Well done!' to encourage.

title: Respect silence
text: Stay quiet when someone is resting nearby.
deeds: Respect silence in one moment today

title: Give seat to child
text: If a child is standing, offer your place kindly.
deeds: Offer your seat to a child today

title: Say 'I am proud of you'
text: Tell a sibling, friend, or teammate 'I am proud of you' sincerely.
deeds: Say 'I’m proud of you' to one person today

title: Praise neatness
text: Notice someone keeping their area tidy and praise it.

title: Offer to share notes
text: If someone missed class, share your notes.
deeds: Share notes with one peer today

title: Encourage discipline
text: Praise a friend for sticking to their schedule.

title: Say 'You matter'
text: Tell someone they matter — even a short message means a lot.
deeds: Say 'You matter' to one person today

title: Offer a sip
text: If you’re drinking water and a friend looks thirsty, offer them a sip.
deeds: Offer a sip of water to someone today

title: Share a shortcut
text: Teach a keyboard shortcut or hack that saves time.

title: Encourage politeness
text: Notice someone saying 'please' or 'thank you' and appreciate it.

title: Offer to sit together
text: Invite someone sitting alone to join your group.
deeds: Invite one person to sit with you today

title: Say 'Good night'
text: At the end of the day, say 'Good night' kindly to family or friend.
deeds: Wish 'Good night' to one person today

title: Praise sharing
text: When you see someone share, say 'That was generous of you.'
deeds: Praise one act of sharing today

title: Offer to stand in line
text: If someone has few items, let them go ahead in a shop queue.
deeds: Let one person go ahead in line today

title: Say 'Best of luck'
text: Tell someone with an exam or meeting 'Best of luck!'

title: Encourage creativity
text: Appreciate someone’s drawing, poem, or post.

title: Offer a simple treat
text: Give a sweet or small snack to brighten someone’s moment.

title: Respect waiting
text: Don’t rush ahead of someone who was waiting before you.
deeds: Wait your turn patiently once today

title: Say 'You inspire me'
text: Tell someone their work or behaviour inspired you.
deeds: Say 'You inspire me' to one person today

title: Offer to explain tech
text: Help someone understand a small app feature.

title: Say 'Thanks buddy'
text: To a friend or colleague, say 'Thanks buddy!' warmly.

title: Praise resilience
text: Tell someone 'You handled that well' after they overcome a small struggle.

title: Offer to open window
text: If air feels stuffy, open a window for fresh air.

title: Encourage honesty
text: When someone admits fault, say 'That was honest of you.'

title: Say 'Good job team'
text: After a group task, say 'Good job team!' aloud.

title: Offer to share food
text: Break a snack into two and share with someone nearby.
deeds: Share food with one person today

title: Compliment clothing
text: Say 'That’s a nice colour on you.'

title: Say 'You’re improving'
text: Notice someone’s growth and tell them 'You’re improving.'
deeds: Say 'You’re improving' to one person today

title: Offer quick help
text: When you see someone lift or carry something heavy, offer a quick hand.

title: Encourage good manners
text: When you hear someone say 'please' or 'thank you', appreciate it.

title: Offer shade
text: If you have an umbrella or shade, let someone share it briefly.

text: Telling someone you trust them builds confidence and connection.

text: If a friend drinks water or eats fruit, say 'Good choice!'

text: Offer to explain one small concept to someone struggling.

text: Tell someone whose action made you happy: 'You made my day!'

title: Offer extra pen
text: Carry a spare pen and lend it when someone needs it.

title: Appreciate teamwork
text: When a task finishes smoothly, say 'That was good teamwork.'

deeds: Say 'I’m here for you' once today

title: Help tidy books
text: Stack or arrange shared books neatly for others.

title: Compliment hairstyle
text: Say 'Your hairstyle looks good today!'

title: Say 'Thanks for waiting'
text: If someone waited for you, thank them sincerely.

title: Encourage fairness
text: Praise when someone plays or acts fairly.

title: Offer to share Wi-Fi
text: If safe and needed, share your hotspot or Wi-Fi briefly.

title: Say 'You did your best'
text: Encourage effort over outcome — 'You did your best.'

title: Offer to pass item
text: If someone can’t reach something, hand it to them politely.

title: Encourage humility
text: When someone admits they don’t know, respond kindly.

text: Notice a kind act and say, 'That was thoughtful.'

text: Ask a peer, 'Should I refill your water bottle too?'

text: Say 'Thank you' to your auto, cab, or bus driver.

title: Encourage sharing notes
text: If someone shares their notes, appreciate it aloud.

text: Tell someone when their small action helped you.

text: If someone struggles with a chair or seat, help them adjust it.

text: If someone is shy, say, 'We’d like to hear your thought.'

text: Before a test or task, tell someone 'Good luck!' warmly.

text: Lend a stapler, ruler, or small tool when needed.

text: Appreciate someone’s attempt even if it didn’t work.

text: If you’re heading the same way, offer a lift if safe.

text: When someone suggests something, say 'Nice idea!' even if unused.

text: If papers are scattered, help arrange them neatly.

text: After finishing a task together, say 'Good teamwork!'

text: When someone thanks you, reply kindly: 'You’re welcome.'

text: Notice a clever act and say 'That was smart!'

title: Help pack
text: Offer to pack books, bags, or materials for someone.

title: Say 'I am thankful'
text: Tell someone directly, 'I am thankful for you.'

title: Offer to hold place
text: Stand in line for a friend briefly if they step out.

title: Say 'You encourage me'
text: Tell someone their kindness motivates you.

title: Help close bag
text: If someone’s bag is open, remind or help close it.
deeds: Close or remind about bag once today

title: Say 'That was nice'
text: Acknowledge a small gesture: 'That was nice.'

title: Offer to guide
text: Guide someone younger through a small process.

title: Say 'You make me smile'
text: Tell someone they make you smile — it brightens their mood.

title: Encourage respect
text: Praise when someone respects others' opinions.

title: Say 'That was helpful'
text: Recognize small help with 'That was helpful.'

text: On a hot day, share your umbrella with a peer.

title: Say 'You did great'
text: Encourage any completed task: 'You did great.'

title: Offer to share book
text: If a classmate forgot, share your textbook.

title: Say 'I respect that'
text: When someone shows courage, say 'I respect that.'

title: Encourage effort
text: Notice someone studying or working and encourage it.

title: Say 'Good evening'
text: Greet someone politely in the evening.

title: Offer to tidy desk
text: If a desk looks messy, help organize it for a moment.

title: Say 'That was kind'
text: Notice an act of kindness and call it out.

title: Help carry water
text: Carry or pass a water jug/bottle for someone.

title: Say 'You made it better'
text: Acknowledge someone’s effort with: 'You made it better.'

title: Offer to share seat
text: On a bench, adjust to make space for another.

title: Say 'I am grateful'
text: Express gratitude directly: 'I am grateful for you.'

title: Encourage politeness
text: Notice kind speech and acknowledge it.

title: Say 'Well done team'
text: After group work, praise the whole team.

title: Offer to share charger
text: If someone’s phone is low, lend your charger.

title: Say 'You made progress'
text: Notice growth: 'You’ve made progress.'

title: Offer to share earphones
text: Safely let a friend listen with one earbud.

title: Say 'I trust your view'
text: Show respect: 'I trust your view on this.'
deeds: Say 'I trust your view' once today

title: Help carry books
text: Offer to carry books for someone struggling.

title: Say 'That was thoughtful'
text: Notice care in action: 'That was thoughtful.'

title: Offer to refill glass
text: Ask: 'Should I refill your glass too?'

title: Say 'I admire your effort'
text: Praise persistence: 'I admire your effort.'
deeds: Say 'I admire your effort' once today

title: Offer to share snack
text: Break food and share with someone nearby.

title: Say 'I value this'
text: Acknowledge small help: 'I value this.'

title: Help shut door
text: Close a door quietly behind you for others.

title: Say 'Good going'
text: Motivate by saying, 'Good going!'

title: Offer to guide junior
text: Help a junior with a short tip.

title: Say 'That was caring'
text: Notice care and acknowledge: 'That was caring.'

title: Offer to share water
text: Pour or offer water to someone before yourself.

title: Say 'You’ve grown'
text: Tell someone you’ve noticed their growth.

title: Help open door
text: Open a door for someone carrying items.

title: Say 'That was respectful'
text: Call out respect when you see it.

title: Offer to explain step
text: If someone is stuck, explain one step gently.

title: Say 'Thanks a lot'
text: Express extra gratitude: 'Thanks a lot!'

title: Help pick object
text: If someone drops something, pick it up.

title: Say 'I admire your courage'
text: When someone shows bravery, praise it.
deeds: Say 'I admire your courage' once today

title: Offer a kind smile
text: Smile at someone who seems low.

title: Say 'That was helpful to me'
text: Acknowledge help: 'That was helpful to me.'
deeds: Say 'That was helpful to me' once today

title: Offer to share charger
text: Let a peer charge their device briefly.

title: Say 'I appreciate your kindness'
text: Notice a kind act and verbalize it.
deeds: Say 'I appreciate your kindness' once today

title: Help adjust seat
text: If someone struggles, help adjust their seat.

title: Say 'That means a lot'
text: When someone helps, tell them 'That means a lot.'
deeds: Say 'That means a lot' once today

title: Offer to share music
text: Play a song someone likes during a break.
deeds: Play or share music once today

title: Say 'I admire your patience'
text: Notice patience and praise it.
deeds: Say 'I admire your patience' once today

title: Help clean board
text: Erase or clean a board for the next person.

title: Say 'Good choice'
text: Notice a healthy choice and praise it.

title: Offer to share taxi
text: If safe, share a ride with a friend going same way.
deeds: Offer to share ride once today

title: Say 'I am with you'
text: Show solidarity: 'I am with you.'
deeds: Say 'I am with you' once today

title: Offer quick help
text: If someone needs assistance, offer your help promptly.

title: Offer quick help
text: If someone struggles briefly, lend a hand without delay — a small help can change their day.
deeds: Offer quick help to someone today

title: Say 'Thanks for listening'
text: When someone listens to you, thank them — it values their time and care.
deeds: Tell one listener 'Thanks for listening' today

title: Offer a small favor
text: Do one tiny favor without being asked — fetch, hold, or pass something.
deeds: Do one small favor for someone today

title: Say 'You made my day'
text: If someone did something kind, tell them 'You made my day.' It encourages more kindness.
deeds: Tell one person 'You made my day' today

title: Offer to proofread
text: Offer to glance over a short message or note for a friend — it saves them time.
deeds: Proofread one short message for someone today

title: Say 'I value you'
text: Share a short sentence: 'I value you' to someone who matters to you.
deeds: Tell one person 'I value you' today

title: Help with small errand
text: Offer to pick up a small item or drop something off when you can.
deeds: Run one small errand for someone today

title: Say 'You helped me grow'
text: Acknowledge someone who contributed to your learning: 'You helped me grow.'
deeds: Tell one person they helped you grow today

title: Offer to share notes
text: If you take good notes, share them with someone who missed class.
deeds: Share notes with one student today

title: Say 'That was thoughtful'
text: Call out thoughtfulness when you see it — it reinforces kind behaviour.

title: Help someone stand
text: Offer your hand or help to someone who is getting up from a seat or ground.
deeds: Assist one person to stand up today

title: Say 'You did well today'
text: End the day by encouraging someone with 'You did well today.'
deeds: Tell someone 'You did well today' before night

title: Offer to water plants
text: If you have time, water a community or shared plant to keep it healthy.

title: Say 'I respect your choice'
text: When someone makes a personal choice, affirm it kindly: 'I respect your choice.'
deeds: Tell one person 'I respect your choice' today

title: Help carry a parcel
text: If a delivery arrives and the recipient is away, help hold or move the parcel safely.
deeds: Hold or move one parcel safely today

title: Say 'You made an impact'
text: Let someone know their small act mattered: 'You made an impact.'
deeds: Tell one person 'You made an impact' today

title: Offer to teach a tip
text: Show a friend a short, useful trick you use — generous teaching helps others.
deeds: Teach one useful tip to someone today

title: Say 'I’m glad you’re here'
text: Express presence: 'I’m glad you’re here' to someone sharing a moment.
deeds: Tell someone 'I’m glad you’re here' today

title: Help tidy common area
text: Pick one item and return it to its place in a shared space.
deeds: Return one stray item to its place today

title: Say 'You’re appreciated'
text: Say plainly 'You’re appreciated' to someone who helped you today.

title: Offer to hold a place
text: If a friend steps away briefly, hold their spot in a line or seat.
deeds: Hold a place for someone once today

title: Say 'I believe in you'
text: Give confidence with 'I believe in you' when someone needs courage.
deeds: Tell one person 'I believe in you' today

title: Offer brief encouragement
text: Send a short message like 'You’ve got this' to someone tackling something hard.

title: Say 'Thanks for your effort'
text: Recognize work with 'Thanks for your effort' even if results vary.
deeds: Thank someone for their effort today

title: Offer to help load
text: Help place something in a car or vehicle if someone is struggling.

title: Say 'I appreciate your honesty'
text: When someone is honest, acknowledge it: 'I appreciate your honesty.'
deeds: Tell someone 'I appreciate your honesty' today

title: Offer a quick compliment
text: Give a crisp compliment — 'That color suits you' — and move on.

title: Say 'You made me smile today'
text: Tell someone they brightened your day with a small act or word.
deeds: Tell someone 'You made me smile today'

title: Offer a short hand
text: Help someone open a jar, lift a lid, or untangle a cord for a minute.
deeds: Help someone with a small task today

title: Say 'You’re thoughtful'
text: Spot thoughtfulness and name it — people value being seen.

title: Offer to share a tip
text: Share one life tip that makes routines easier — simple help is powerful.
deeds: Share one practical tip with someone today

title: Say 'You’ve been helpful'
text: Let a helper know they made things easier: 'You’ve been helpful.'
deeds: Tell one helper they were helpful today

title: Offer to help arrange
text: If a shelf or table is messy, spend two minutes to arrange it.
deeds: Arrange one small area for others today

title: Say 'Your time matters'
text: Acknowledge someone’s invested time: 'Your time matters to me.'

title: Offer a spare pen
text: Keep a spare pen on hand and lend it to someone who needs one.
deeds: Lend a pen to someone today

title: Say 'That helped me a lot'
text: When an act was meaningful, tell the person it helped you a lot.
deeds: Tell someone 'That helped me a lot' today

title: Offer a quick note
text: Leave a short note of thanks or encouragement on someone’s desk.

title: Say 'I admire your patience'
text: When someone waits calmly, acknowledge their patience with kind words.

title: Offer to help carry kids’ items
text: Hold a stroller bag or small toy for a parent for a moment.
deeds: Help a parent with a small item today

title: Say 'You matter to me'
text: Tell someone plainly that they matter to you — the words have weight.
deeds: Tell one person 'You matter to me' today

title: Offer a warm goodbye
text: When parting, give a warm goodbye — it leaves a good last impression.
deeds: Say a warm goodbye to someone today

title: Say 'I’m grateful for you'
text: Express deep gratitude to someone who supports you often.
deeds: Tell one person 'I’m grateful for you' today

title: Offer to help with groceries
text: If a neighbor needs help bringing groceries inside, offer a hand.
deeds: Help carry groceries for someone today

title: Say 'You made a difference'
text: Acknowledge impact: 'You made a difference today.'
deeds: Tell one person 'You made a difference' today

title: Offer a final thanks
text: Before sleep, thank one person who supported your day.
deeds: Say thanks to one person tonight

title: Celebrate small kindness
text: Reflect on the year of small deeds and celebrate the habit you built.
deeds: Do one small act of kindness and reflect on it
